name: RNCrawford
review_text: First off, verified purchase through Amazon from a self professed (and often accused) coffee snob.  Second...while I know that people have differing experiences with the same product due to a host of valid reasons, posts claiming that not having a pod holder making this brewer "useless" and 1 staring it?  Sorry, pet peeve about entitled personage hyperbole.  My review is going to be blunt and perhaps a little stinging out of my annoyances about such idiotic reviews/comments cropping in, I'll try to keep that to a minimum.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Debbie Lee Wesselmann
review_text: Ever since I bought my mother a similar 2.0 model over a year ago and been using it weekly, I've been waiting for my old one to die so that I could replace it with this.  Although the old one is still going strong, we decided to find another place for it.  I bought this one without hesitation.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Rosemary S. Allan
review_text: I returned it within 2 weeks for a full refund.  The one star is for the negative experience I had due to Keurig not advising buyers to avoid certain practices.  Before I comment, there is a warning for any newer model Keurig owner!  DO NOT USE SOFTENED WATER, EVEN IF IT IS FILTERED!!! The coffee pods were splitting and overflowing grains into almost every cup I made, causing me to throw away over a dozen coffee pods, not to mention wasted creamer and believing there was problem with the pod holder or needle that puncture the pod.  I had no idea it was because of the softened, filtered water I was using from my fridge dispenser.  I went to Keurig and YouTube online, tried cleaning options, could find no help from FAQ's for this particular problem, and finally gave up, returning it to Amazon.  Amazon is refunding me fully and I appreciate their policy.  I then went to a BB&B, purchased another Keurig model, and the same thing happened due to not knowing about the water problem.  This time, I called Keurig and talked to a rep, who after hearing the description of the problem, asked what kind of water I was using.  Such a simple solution, yet Keurig does not mention anything about this in the instruction booklet that comes with their products or with their FAQ's!!! When I asked the rep if she had received other calls of similar concerns, she said she gets them often.  If I had known this, I would have kept the original K475 model.  I still like the brewed coffee I get from Keurig devices, but please Keurig, give your loyal customers a heads up!!
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Will
review_text: Before buying this product I read a lot of reviews and researched like crazy to see what kinds of features I needed in a Keurig. I must say that the main concern that I saw in the reviews was that the Digital Rights Management controlled what type of K cups would be accepted in the 2.0 brewers, but what I have found out is that a lot of aftermarket or brand Kcups that aren't affiliated with Keurig are making their lids compatible with this model so there is really no need to have to hack it. I can buy kcups through other companies at a much lower price and their kcup tops pass through that DRM system so that I am able to enjoy my favorite cup of joe at a way better price than the competitors.
review_title: Love the k475 plus but would have gone with Sams model 425s with more goodies!
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Packrat
review_text: I now have had my 3rd Keurig ( K475) for a week and it does what it is supposed to. It basically is the same as the K 300 I had which had started to "spit" a lot and take a long time to finish brewing a cup. It felt like twice as long but probably was not. So far I have needed a new one every 2+ years. I brew 100+ cups a month. When I had a regular coffee pot I never got the amount of coffee right and hated that I could not make 1or 2 cups at a time. So, I have been a K-cup fan since the first one I bought.
review_title: My 3rd Keurig-and no problem with non_Keurig pods
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Alyeska NC
review_text: We like the convenience of Keurig coffeemakers, so when our old one started to have problems (the interior pump was starting to fail), we went online to shop for a replacement.  This one holds more water than our old one (40 oz vs 70 oz) so you don't have to fill it up as often.  Unlike our previous model, this one does not have a clock for programming on/off times.  The unit shuts down automatically after being idle for an hour.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Matt H.
review_text: I have owned and used a Keurig brewer for the past 5 years.  When it was time to replace it, I purchased the K475 Plus.  After setting the unit up, I encountered trouble brewing coffee; the cup was filled with coffee grounds. Additionally, 3-4 times I received and error message on the LCD screen, stating that the brewing was interrupted and that I maintenance was required. I tried a total of 12 K-cups from 3 different brands with the same results. I contacted the Keurig help line, and was assisted by very nice, knowledgeable people that walked me through some maintenance procedures.  The problem persisted, so they determined that they would send me a replacement unit. The replacement arrived 6 days later.  Upon setting the unit up, it became evident that the features of the replacement did not match the features of the original unit. Again, I called Keurig who determined through the serial number on the replacement unit, that they sent me a lower model than what I had purchased.  The exact comment was "...the replacement is not the advanced unit you purchased...."  I was placed on hold for several minutes to wait for customer care. The person returned to the line, stating that customer care was extremely busy, and could they get a callback number from me, and that someone would call me back within 48 hours.  48 hours?  The problem has gone on unresolved too long ad was exacerbated by Keurig sending me the wrong unit. My original unit is on its way back to Amazon, which is what I should have done in the 1st place.
review_title: Defective product followed by customer care missteps
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: ZX
review_text: Makes a great cup of coffee and has a lot of advance features (different sizes, temperature settings, wallpaper, clock display, many presets, etc.).  I deducted a star for the stupid DRM.  For those wanting to "hack" by cutting the green wire, don't!  If you open it up, there are actually two green wires, one in the back (smaller ~24 gauge) and one in the front bottom (~20 gauge) of the unit.  Cutting/disconnecting the rear wire will render the unit unless.  It will not brew anything.  Cutting/disconnecting the front wire doesn't appear to do anything, that I can tell.  The only thing I can think of is Keurig mixed up the wires to confuse us "normal folks" so we'll buy their 2.0 k-cups.  I guess it's back to taping a valid 2.0 label on to the sensor to "fool" the system.  I will continue to research and will post updates as I get them.
review_title: Almost a perfect coffee maker...too bad it's ruined by greedy DRM.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: K. Roberts
review_text: I bought this machine so I could have one coffee maker that makes both single cups and a carafe. If you want to just make single cups, then I think you will be happy with it. Although, you can only use Keurig approved coffee cups, which is super annoying if you like the off brand ones (and also greedy on Keurig's part.)
review_title: Don't buy for the Carafe feature.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Bob409
review_text: We replaced our 2-year old K 2.0 model with this newer version, hoping to get a hotter cup of coffee, and perhaps a little faster brew. This model has all the features we want, so we decided to purchase the same model. Big mistake.
review_title: Fine if you only like warm coffee.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Don L.
review_text: We've had this Keurig since mid-March 2017 It is a replacement for a previous generation Keurig that lasted about 4 1/2 years.  This one is basically junk.  Half the time it refuses to brew a complete cup by giving an error message that the pressure is too high.  This requires you to go thru a stupid process with a little cleaner bulb that they include in the box.  It does this whether using Green Mountain (Keurig brand) K-cups, Tully's,  off-brand cups, it doesn't matter.  Why don't they just fix the device so it works? The design of the water reservoir is the worst I've seen in any coffee maker.  While it holds an advertised 70 oz of water, it has to be hung on the side of the housing just right, because two little off-set security tabs go into two equally little ports on the machine to hold the thing on.  Once you finally get the reservoir fastened to the device, you have to reinstall the reservoir cover, which is curved in two axies and has to be fastened front to back.  The previous generation container was a simple lift-off and lift-on for both the reservoir and lid.  When it works, it's  okay, when it doesn't it's simply crap.  More than once I've been tempted to take it into the back yard and beat it to pieces with a shovel (and I'm a pacifist at heart).  It deserves a 2 1/2 star review at best.  But like I said it makes good coffee, when it works.
review_title: It deserves a 2 1/2 star review at best.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: J. Boone
review_text: We have had a Keurig for several years and we love the convenience.  This model has a serious design flaw - the touchscreen control panel is located directly over the brewing cup.  After about 1 month of operation, the screen readout was garbled and you could not operate the coffee maker.  Unplugging and plugging back in reset the display for a few times then it would not reset.  We returned the unit.  The replacement has worked for about 8 months but it has succumbed to the same ailment. I am guessing that the high temperature and humidity in the display's location is the reason for the failures.  I will probably get another Keurig but will never get a model that has the control panel in this location.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: TAMMY ANDERSON
review_text: I love Keurig products and this is the 5th one I have purchased but I definitely hate that I can only use Keurig products.  I have see where devices and hacks to override the sensor but why even put this feature on the machine.  I just cut the top off a regular one and place it over the " NonKeurig coffee brands and it works.  Also, I do not think this is heating up to 190 degree.  It would be a pain to pack it up and send it back.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: John S
review_text: It came to to replace an aging, dependable Keurig that was 5+ Years old, in my opinion it s was like separating with a loved one. But no worries, a new keurig with more gel,s a whistles would easily help forget my dependable coffee maker, right? Wrong, this replacement is by far, the worst and least dependable coffee brewer if ever owned. Made my $20 Mr Coffee seem like a $600 Espresso machine compared to this Keurig. 1st issue is the dreaded  needle under pressure  error that prevents you from making a cup of coffee at 4:30 am until you clean the needle. No worries, it comes with a bulb thing that helps manually clean the needle, 1 minute later, I should be brewing?, no, in addition to that process, make a playing hot cup of water as well, and yes, it s now 4:40 and that first cups almos done. You would be concerned if this happened occasionally, but I deal with this every 3 days, that s even after doing a full cleaning, with filter change, and descalling on Saturday, yes, Rhys is the second time since this ultra cleaning it s ran into this issue. 2nd issue, the display goes wonky, and you can t read the screen, it s like the windows Blue Screen of death, and yes, requires you to unglug the machine to fix the issue, which means resetting the clock as well. If your thinking of buying the 475 or 575 , donate the money to the Red Cross, I ve never gotten screwed by the Red Cross, but fit 7 months, the people at Keurig laugh at me for buying there junk. This unfortunately is my last Keurig, sines I feel buying  a $799 espresso machine is more cost effective and pays for itself in 7 months, if I factor the Jet Fuel k-cups I buy every w weeks, at $60 buck a case. The coffee is a 5 star for you coffee aficionados that will pay top dollar for an exceptional bean. The draw back Is what those plastic k-cups are doing to our landfills. If you re still thinking this review is crap?, then buy that Keurig machine and get the Jet Fuel coffee, go ahead an splurge, since your obviously setting yourself for dissipate Snd a gluten for punishment after buying it after I warned you, but if you find this spot on in 7 months, and see this review again, stop in and review my new Espresso machine.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Michael and Kimmy Longfoot
review_text: DO NOT BUY FROM WAREHOUSE DEALS!!!!!!!! We purchased the product with our prime membership expecting it in 2 days, only for it to come close to three weeks later!  Then we plug it in and the screen is all dysfunctional, and that it is missing the "water collection basin" we had a similar Keurig prior so just used that basin, but the Keurig itself still worked, not even two days later the whole thing stops working, won't turn on, spits out water, just leaves a complete mess! The response I got, return it and wait for a new one, those who know the coffee need waiting another two and a half weeks is NOT an option, we ended up going to Target spending way more tens we wanted but we gave our coffee. Awful products bring sent out, and missing pieces. Awful customer service, my responsibility to return and wait AGAIN, and NO ACCOUNTABILITY on their behalf.
review_title: Don't buy from Amazon warehouse deals!!!!!!!!!!!!
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Pamela Mortensen
review_text: I had to call Keurig customer service because the coffee maker wouldn't pump water, and the control panel said it needed more water, when it was completely full. They told me they would send a new water reservoir. Later that day they called me, and said, they weren't sending it, and didn't think that would work, and I should send it back. I told her that I had taken the water reservoir from the Keurig I was replacing, and it did work. That Keurig only gives you half cups of coffee and was purchased last December. This is my 5th Keurig and they all last about a year. I took an extra two year warranty out this time, so I can get two years use out of it. Don't take the water reservoir off to refill it. Pour water in the top, and leave the reservoir engaged, and it will last longer.
review_title: I had to call Keurig customer service because the coffee ...
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: R. J. Benson
review_text: I was looking for a consistent coffee experience.  I'd done the drip makers, bought a peculator and was OK with it, went with a French press [liked it the most], but they all were weak in certain areas. I'd seen [and used] more and more Keurig units in the past 6 months and was trying to find a way to use it that didn't involve the over priced cups and landfill fodder.  I tried the reusable K-cup and it works well enough.  I save on coffee and don't add to the plastic going to be buried somewhere.  It's not perfect.  The coffee is not as robust as I'd hoped, but it is adequate and I'm using far less coffee than when I was using the French press.  I find the 10 oz setting and my dark roast coffee ground fine is the combination for the reusable cup method.  I discovered that the K-cups hold more coffee than they want you to use in the refillable K-Cup, so there is some further experimenting on the horizon.  It works well for my 2 cup of coffee mornings, but I'm not retiring the French press.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: ellenindc
review_text: Beware buyers:  Keurig is making its machines to run only on their label coffees beginning with the 2.0 model.  I don't know about you, but their coffee cups are lousy and, even the good brands they purchased, became lousy.  My favorite coffee, Chock Full O Nuts, Midtown Manhattan will not work in a Keurig machine.  So, I called Keurig and learned they really don't care a fig.  I called the distributor of Midtown Manhattan and they do care but short of sending me a box of coffee, they can't do much else.  So, if you are not satisfied like myself with Keurig coffees, do not buy this machine!
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Lisa C
review_text: I decided on this model, after my previous Keurig stopped working after three year of daily use.  Despite all the negative reviews, I purchased it, knowing that it 1... might be louder than my last one 2...may clog,3... the touch screen might be a pain and 4...it won't brew the pods I already have here at home.  So....so far, so good, actually.  Yes, it's louder.  Not obscenely loud, but definitely louder than my last model, and it kind of seems like it's louder, longer.  If that makes sense.  The touch screen, for me, is a plus.  I don't mind the extra half second it takes to choose the size of my cup, and actually love how easy the whole thing is to use. The whole pod issue, for me, hasn't been one yet.  I've used all different kinds over the past week, and was only told once that it didn't brew the specific pod my daughter had put it, but we hit the button again, and it worked....so, no issues with this popular complaint , yet.  I've been using it for a week today.  I'll come back and update if I have any problems, but, right now, I'm thinking this was a great purchase.
review_title: Makes a great cup of coffee...
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: K. Miller
review_text: I upgraded from my B40 that I bought about 7 years ago. There was absolutely nothing wrong with the B40. I wanted more options and the ability to have a carafe if guests were visiting. First, the K475 is super easy to set up. I like that it has a filter, which the B40 does not. It helps ease my mind that the water is cleaner and tastes better. It's not as loud as the B40. The B40 sounded like it was having a hard time pumping water in and I really like that the reservoir is much larger (22 oz more). I enjoy hot chocolate so I like that there is a setting for that, as well as just hot water for tea, etc. I also like that I can choose different sizes depending on if I'm running out the door or if I want a small cup of tea. The "strong" feature is nice. Overall, I couldn't be more happy with it. I did lots of research on different websites and was hesitant at first since my B40 had worked so well. I definitely recommend it to anyone.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: ADZ
review_text: OK so I bought this machine to replace my original Keurig that would use any cup from any manufacturer.
review_title: Let me just say that the hacks work GREAT!!
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Trevor Ferguson
review_text: Awesome machine. It didn't come with the carafe for brewing pots of coffee but you can. Uh that separate. We set it to heat up the water between certain hours and then when we get out of bed we simply brew it. You can't set it to automatically brew but it does save time not having to wait for the water to heat up. I love how we can change the water temperature! It's a great machine and we have no regrets about purchasing it!
review_title: Awesome machine. It didn't come with the carafe for ...
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: tlod0813
review_text: I had an original from years ago. I abandoned the concept because it seemed to be a poor value. I was excited to revisit after reading about the new 2.0 system. Here are my thoughts:
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: ksteinhoff
review_text: This is probably the fourth Keurig I've owned over the years. I went into it knowing that I had half a dozen third-party cups that wouldn't work with Keurig's copy protection, but I expected the darned thing to work otherwise.
review_title: Display is blank, has lines or is inverted. Avoid this machine
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Yorkie Mom
review_text: This Keurig allows me to make 5 cups of coffee at one time in an thermal carafe.  It is very user friendly and doesn't take up any more room then our original Keurig.  It is attractive on the counter and heats the water quickly for your next cup.  We use it to heat water for hot chocolate and tea.  It does not make as much noise as our old Keurig.  I would give it a thumbs up!
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: J.C.
review_text: This K475 worked for less than a year. It no longer powers on. The "power button" appears in the lower right-hand corner, but no amount of pressing it will turn the damn thing on.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: GPie
review_text: I want to love it, but it's a complete waste of money.  Keurig is selling a product that makes a carafe of coffee, but even keurig doesn't make a refillable carafe pod?  What a shame.  There are many reusable pods available for sale on Amazon that claim to support 2.0, but they don't work.  They error out.  I am extremely disappointed.  Don't waste your money on buying the carafe or this maker if you drink anything more than one small 12 oz cup of coffee in a day.  Wish is would have known all this before spending so much money in this machine and the separate carafe which I can't use.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: J. Carver
review_text: I bought a Keurig after much hesitation because it was getting harder and harder to find a reliable and quick source for coffee for my Tassimo brewer. I still use the Tassimo, too, and find it easier to use than the Keurig and it generally makes better coffee.  I have yet to find a coffee blend for the Keurig that I love but most I've tried are okay and there are certainly more blends available than for Tassimo. If I run out I can make a quick run to the grocery for more.  The options on this machine are okay, I guess, but I'm not sure the strong brew option helps that much.  The machine itself seem cheap and It's cumbersome filling the water reservoir. The Tassimo is easier and has lasted me at least three years, too.  I was mostly hesitant about the Keurig due to reports of it failing after limited use and clogging due to hard water. (In reviews and from relatives, neighbors, etc)  We'll see how long it lasts.  This machine comes with a de-clogging device but haven't needed it yet.
review_title: It serves the purpose I guess
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Micah Harkins
review_text: Even though Keurig makes their products so that they break often, My last one worked for a year, then the inside bottom needle part broke off, so I bought this as a replacement.  It works great, and is the same model I had before.  This particular model is one of the better Keurig machines, and lasts a long time as long as you take very good care of it, use a Keurig filter, and ONLY EVER use purified and/or distilled water.  IF YOU USE TAP WATER OR HARD WATER THE SCALE WILL BUILD UP IN THE MACHINE AND IT WILL BREAK WITHIN MONTHS.  We have to triple purify our water so it doesn t damage the machine.  Be sure to buy the warranty that is optional for it, you ll need it!
review_title: Take Good Care of it and NEVER use powdered drinks and it Will Last A Long Time
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: A. Polasky
review_text: Purchased this machine one month ago.  I get it, and after 2 brews I had to return it for a new one because Digital face went out on it.  I get new one and I have been having issues with machine.  At least every other brew it stops mid brew and displays message that it needs to be serviced.  I don't know why it is plugging up.  It's new it shouldn't do this.  So now After every cup i brew i have to run a brew cycle of water just to be sure it will brew next cup without fail.  A few years back I never had issues with these machines.  I guess they are using cheaper parts or  just not giving a crap during assembly.  This will be THE LAST Keurig I purchase ever!  Sad really, because I really enjoy the coffee it brews.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Dave Vasquez
review_text: We actually loved this thing. It brews a great cup of coffee (as long as you clean and maintain it). We have taken great care of this thing and cleaned/maintained it as instructed in the manual. However, we're just shy of 6 months of use and the machine has stopped working completely. The irony is that the machine itself, the coffee maker portion probably still works fine. It's the LCD DISPLAY that is non functional. The display started acting up within one month of use. Now at barely 6 months, the display no longer works at all. It still displays the power button on the screen as normal, but it is completely unable to power on because it won't register any touch at all. This is completely unacceptable and just way below any reasonable level of quality for a device that costs over $100. I would expect in the year 2018 that Keurig could manufacture an LCD display that lasts longer than 6 months. I can NOT in good conscious recommend this particular model. If you're looking to buy one, avoid the models with the LCD Display until Keurig redesigns them. I'm hoping I can get an exchange as I believe we are still under warranty. But, if we ever buy another Keurig it WON'T have the LCD display.
review_title: Great Coffee Maker until the LCD Display Dies
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Annie
review_text: This is our second Keurig K-Cup system.  The K475 is a handsome piece of equipment.  It makes an outstanding cup of coffee.  The options offered with this system as to cup size, temperature, and strength of coffee brew are wonderful.  I am very pleased.
review_title: and strength of coffee brew are wonderful. I am very pleased
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: LG
review_text: This is my second Keurig I went without for a while because they made them to only be able to use keurig coffee pods and I refused to be held hostage to that. I was told that they change that for all the models ending in 0 (zero). So I bought this one. I have had it for just over a month and it stopped working. I make a cup of coffee and it runs through and does not push that burst of air through anymore at the end so it sits there and drips all over. I have cleaned it, tried it with the decanter, different size cups and it just drips. It is real bad if you are using the reusable pods then it runs out long after the cycle is done. And of course it is just over the 30 day warranty so I can t send it back. I think I will go back to a regular drip
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Father Knows Best
review_text: So far so good.  We have had the unit for several months now.  Just what we needed for making a quick cup of coffee in the morning.  Since we are on a well we love the filter feature to keep the internal parts of the machine clean.  Only time will tell.  I hope it lasts at least a couple of years.
review_title: Great for that quick cup of coffee in the morning.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jake
review_text: Had this since March 2018. It was my first Keurig, and maybe my first mistake... I thought lets get one with all the new features. So for the first few weeks it worked just fine, albeit a little louder than expected. The coffee tasted fine, and it performed as designed. Then after a couple weeks I started my morning with a small issue. The power button wouldn't work. I kept hitting it for a few seconds, and then decided to unplug it to reset it. Then it worked fine, made my coffee and went on about my day. About a week later it happened again, and again a few days later after that. Now it almost happens all the time, and resetting it by unplugging it no longer works. So much for my first Keurig and all the great things I heard about them. This morning, with a lot of persistence, it took me 22 minutes to finally get the unit to turn on so I could simply make a cup of coffee. I am going to see if it can be repaired (should still be under warranty), but if not; i'm going to take it out back and put it out of MY misery!!!
review_title: It was my first Keurig, and maybe my first mistake...
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Max W.
review_text: A severe metallic taste persisted even after numerous test runs both with and without cleaning vinegar. It was so overpowering that the unit was unusable. What I should have done is return it to Amazon for replacement, but instead I called Keurig, and they shipped me a new replacement. However, it was the model K425. They claimed it was identical to the K475 except it didn't have some complimentary coffees included and on Amazon, the listed price was $2 less. I doubt that is true, but the replacement is working well, and I'm happy with it. This review, however, is for the K475 and based on the one I received, it rates only one start. Keurig also required I ship them, at my expense, the cup holder from the K475 which would disable it. It was cheap enough, less than $4, but they should have paid for the return postage. The old disable K475 is stored now for possible parts usage down the line somewhere, but with the persistent plastic taste, it's useless.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Donald
review_text: The brewer works fine but the problem I have is with the water tank. It is very difficult to take off when it needs filling and it s even harder to replace when filled. It's supposed to attach to two small hooks on the side but it s extremely difficult to line up and attach. It s just poor product design. Other than that, I have no problem with the coffee maker.
review_title: Hard to reattach water tanks when filled.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: WPW
review_text: As the owner of a manufacturing company I am not one to write reviews and knock someone's products but this thing took me over the edge. You can mess with a lot of my things but don't mess with my coffee first thing in the morning! I bought this coffee maker thinking that it would be an "upgrade" from my older Keurig. Big mistake. My old original Keurig made thousands of cups of coffee without any problems but finally the old faithful wore out and died...sad day. First issue I ran into with this new model was the fact that I couldn't use certain brands of coffee if they weren't set up with the greedy people at Keurig. 2nd problem is that it plugs up very often and interrupts the brew cycle due to "needle under pressure" which in turn wastes these expensive Keurig pods. I have done many needle maintanence cycles only to gain 1 cup of coffee and trash another pod and wasting 15 to 20 minutes to get a cup of coffee. All this fancy technology has proven to be less satisfaction than the old fashioned basic brewer.
review_title: Don't waste your time and money on this thing.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: David Johnston
review_text: This Keurig replaced one of the first generation units that we'd had for ages. While it's an okay unit, there are a few things about it I don't like, and that a potential buyer should be aware of.
review_title: Okay, but actually prefer the first generation one we replaced with this unit. A few reasons why...
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Anonymous User
review_text: The major flaw in this machine is that it is not designed to work with softened water. This will cause your machine to get clogged and have to be cleaned very often (weekly if not more). If it does get clogged, it will make a mess with coffee grounds everywhere. I'm not sure why they didn't account for this when designing the product since millions of people have softened water in the US.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Readefam 1986
review_text: I like the fact that I can control the brew strength and water temperature. I have not had a bad cup of coffee from this machine. I bought this size just to prevent having to refill the machine too often and I am happy it allows us at least 7-12oz cups before refilling. This just allows me to get out the door quicker. The machines with the smaller reservoir would be a point of contention for me. I am so happy with this new machine and the coffee flavor has been excellent as well. I have some Starbucks pods, Green Mountain, and tea pods and each and every one has been delicious: and I am quite the picky coffee drinker as I like it strong but not bitter. I have not gotten a bitter cup yet. Way to go Keurig!
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: AC
review_text: Love the convenience, but Keurig machines don't last. This one lasted less than 9 months and then completely stopped working.
review_title: Should last better than they do
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Greg
review_text: Can't recommend:  My wife and I ordered this unit in April 2017.  We followed all of the recommended cleanings, filter replacements, etc. for our first Keurig unit and it lasted quite a few years.  This new unit, however, has not been reliable.  And now we are told it's no longer exchangeable.  We have maintained it, as instructed, but yet not 2-3 weeks go by without the unit having issues making coffee, getting grounds all over the counter (and sometimes us!)  It's simply not built as well and not reliable.  I would stay away from this one until Keurig decides to build something better.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Erin Megan
review_text: I gave this 2 stars because I literally have had this for a single month and the screen no longer works.  It is completely frozen as a lit up blank screen and I'm not able to return/exchange the product.  Very disappointed in this.  I can understand that maybe I got a defective one, but to not be able to return/exchange the product after only a month of ownership seems ridiculous......especially for widely popular product like Keurig.
review_title: Screen stops working after a month.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I did not expect to like this as much as I do. My husband will drink almost an entire pot of coffee by himself before he goes to work. With our old coffee maker, by the time he got to the last cup, the coffee is already starting to taste burnt and stale from being on the warming burner. By the time I get around to it, it's definitely burnt. With the Keurig, every cup of coffee is fresh. We have the reusable pods so we don't generate any additional landfill waste and we're able to brew the coffee we like and save money not having to buy the one-time use pods. Definitely recommend getting the reusable pods. We also specifically got this model because it accepts karafe pods to brew up to 16oz cups. This was a must have feature for us since the hubby drinks at least a 16oz cup at a time. That also allows us to brew using the karafe when we need multiple cups at a time.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jane in Granville
review_text: Bought this expecting to be able to use the reusable pods. After finishing up the purchased coffee filled pods, I got out the new reusable pods, the new paper filters I had purchased and the new reusable pod for the carafe, plus paper filters. I proceeded to load the reusable filter into the pod holder but it was immediately obvious it was not going to work. After finding no instructions in the Kuerig booklet, I went on line and found the owners manual (was not included with the 400 series coffee maker). That's when, with a magnifying glass, I discovered that the 400 series is not compatible with the reusable filters. I'm saying if I had read this on the box I would not have purchased this particular model. Back to buying the expensive coffee pods. I gave this 3 stars because if you don't mind buying your coffee in pods then the maker works great.
review_title: Don't make the same mistake I did.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amy Strauch
review_text: Sadly this Keurig model doesn't measure up to the original model that we had for almost 5 years.  The K475 has several critical flaws that make it a hassle to use.  The model does not fit standard travel mugs, even with the drip tray removed for more space.  The Water tank has to be refilled almost overtime we use it and can only make 3 cups of coffee before the refill light appears - even though the tank is still 1/3 of the way full.  But perhaps the most frustrating part of the K475 is the non-stop dripping of coffee once a cup has been brewed.  The tower drips for almost 1 minute before you can finally remove your cup.  My husband was certain the newer model would be just as great as the previous one, and usually he is right about that.  But this time....I desperately wished we had just ordered the original because this one is far from an improvement.
review_title: Stick with the original model - this one is not an improvement.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Karla Jay
review_text: I would give it a 0 if it was available. The coffee made by this machine has a distinctive burned electric smell/taste.  I ran vinegar through the machine and numerous containers of water but the taste/smell still lingered.  Exchanged unit and the replacement still had the same issue.  I am in the process of returning the second unit and have ordered a brewer made by another company.  Also, the K475 is very loud and slow.  You an hear the unit pumping the water through the K-Cup into the cup and it is annoying.  The water is also not as hot as I would like.  I ordered this when my Cuisinart died hoping that this would be a great machine but I am returning to the Cuisinart.  It is quiet and makes a good cup of coffee.  I will live without the carafe.  WHY CAN'T KEURIG MAKE A DECENT COFFEE MACHINE?  YOU WOULD THINK THIS WOULD BE THE KEY TO MOVING THEIR CASH COW K-CUPS.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: j.Smith
review_text: This was a purchase to replace our Keurig Vue since they discontinued making the Vue cups. Read all the reviews thought it would work but was sadly disappointed. If you like coffee grounds in your cup this is the machine for you. It continuously stopped up with coffee grounds and had to be cleaned. And there were so many grounds in the cup you would have to strain it through a strainer to remove the grounds before you can drink it. Very disappointed. I loved the view even when using my own coffee grounds it worked great. We tried the pods as well as our own grounds using even a paper filter in the adapter and still there were so many coffee grounds in the cup you couldn't drink it. I am now or during the Keurig Elite to see if it might work better than this model. I hate spending this amount of money on a coffee maker when my view was perfectly fine but they discontinued the pods
review_title: Very disappointing too many coffee grounds in the cup
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: E. M. Wilder
review_text: Perfect for my husband and myself who drink 2-3 cups of coffee a day.  No more wasting half of a pot of coffee down the drain.  Programmable features are easy to understand and easy to use.  Provides a lot of flexibility, from how hot you want the water to be, to the strength, to the number of ounces you wish to brew.  Although it says "Single Serve," it will actually make a carafe of coffee if desired.  It still does not make coffee quite as strong as I like it so I have to process two 4 oz cups.  My husband, on the other hand, is very happy with an 8oz serving using one pod.  It will also provide hot water and accepts hot chocolate, tea, and K-cup filters.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Samuel W. Siciliano Jr.
review_text: We really like this coffee maker for K-cups.  It's much better than our last Keurig and works great.  It also has an extra water filter if you wanted to use that feature.  The filters are relatively inexpensive and last about 3 months.  If you keep this machine clean by sticking to the maintenance schedule, it should last a long time with very good coffee.  Don't forget to run a cup of water after flavored coffee or cocoa so the flavors don't mix.
review_title: really nice machine and works great
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Ohio'
review_text: Wow...bought this to replace a less expensive model and It's AMAZING! Very well made. The Keurig lift bar is very durable in this higher end model. The cover for the reservoir is also well designed. Front half holds open to add water instead of removed entire lid! Front display tells you everything you need to know and do!!! Great for someone new to Keurig, or anyone wanting to make coffee, hot chocolate.  Well made and designed. These extra features are wonderful!
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: RACjr
review_text: First, for those just buying this machine please understand that since Keurig brought out an updated model that the carafe no longer comes with this model! So if you want the carafe purchase it from Walmart it is cheaper there than anywhere else.
review_title: K475 what you get with it... no carafe comes with this machine.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Opio
review_text: Had another brand single serve coffee maker for about a year and a half.  It failed with light use so bought this one.  Really like it, fast, versatile and makes good coffee and importantly works with 1.0 and 2.0 pods.  A little pricey but I'm happy.  Hope it works for awhile.  Additional comment.  We have been using this item for several months now.  Still like it but have noticed a disappointing fact.  We bought this coffee maker, in part, because of the large water tank.  Trouble is it requires refill when the water level is at about 40 %.  There is plenty of water remaining to make two or three more cups of 10 or 12 ounces each but it won't let you proceed.  I have down graded it to three stars.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jeannette Cassity
review_text: The first generation Keurig got at least to 190 ! This one is so much slower and right out of the cup, immediately, it s only 180 ! Not at all what I expected after owning three Keurig coffee makers. I m not very happy with this one.
review_title: It takes longer than previous Keurig s and doesn t get nearly as hot.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: LNG
review_text: I'm really not sure how I have gone this long without a keurig. I had a Hamilton Beach carafe/pod combo machine that was garbage. The pods always tasted horrible. I couldn't tell it if was the machines or the pods I didn't like. So finally I bought one of these. WOW. everything tastes so much better. It has multiple size, and brew strength settings which is great. And the water reservoir is large enough to make a few cups before needing to refill.
review_title: Why didn't I buy this sooner?
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Dennis C
review_text: This is by far the worst coffee maker I have ever purchased.  Forget the fact that you are forced to use their pods, but the machine was constantly plagued by over pressurization issues and clogged water outlets. Now after just one year, the control screen is just a series of horizontal lines and completely useless.  I will never own another Keurig machine again. I would have given it 0 stars if that option was available.
review_title: This is by far the worst coffee maker I have ever purchased
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Mom of 3
review_text: I love this!  I had the K55.  This gives you the option for auto off, stronger brewing, hot chocolate, more sizes etc.  I will say it has  had  a few more errors though.  I never had any issues with my old one.  I've had an error several times already that's told me to take the pod out close and redo.  Not too big a deal. This one is much easier to clean on the inside also.  I love that it tells you if it needs cleaning!  I'm super happy with my purchase especially since I got a great deal on it in the warehouse (like new).
review_title: Love my upgraded keurig!  No regrets
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: F&G
review_text: Had to return this - I was excited because it had the larger water capacity but this thing makes so much noise - this is our 3rd Keurig so we know they make noise when the steam is coming out but this made noise like a washing machine even when it was warming up and it needed to warm up after every cup no matter how long the water had been in the tank.  I would have loved it but went back to my old model and am happy with that.  This wasn't worth the extra money.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: grayvard
review_text: I've had it for nearly a year now. Got it for $80 through Amazon marketplace in a distressed box.(The price went up to $100 next day).
review_title: Really glad I bought it when I did.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Melissa Perry Moraja: Award Winning Author
review_text: Love this Keurig! We had purchased another prior that we returned because it didn't have a large enough water capacity. This one is perfect! It allows you to brew different sizes 8 oz, 10 oz, 12 oz, 16 oz and more; and different strength coffee. It also offers a setting for hot chocolate which is one of my kids favorites. Easy to use and easy to program! It also offers different screen color options so it matches with your kitchen colors. Pretty innovative. Highly recommend!
review_title: Our favorite! Easy to use and program. Offers a lot of different options.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: barbill28
review_text: I had the Keurig B60 for years, in that time I rarely had an issue with it. I replaced the solenoid once during that time. I purchased This K475 just a little over two weeks ago and already got an error (water pressure to high). This indicated the upper needle valve it clogged. I had to use the silicone bulb it comes with to fill with water to clean the needle and clear the error. This has only made two cups of coffee a day during that two week period. I have since read a lot of complaints for this same issue. I also use only quality K-cups that are approved and licensed by Keurig so that shouldn't be an issue. If this is a continuing problem then the quality of design has gone down on these machines. For the price you shouldn't have these kind of issues with a machine in such a short time. Others stated they couldn't get the error to go away and had to have a replacement unit deliver.
review_title: Not off to a good start.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Ken Mitch
review_text: I'm not one for writing reviews, but I had to write something about this product. First off, when the Keurig works, it works great. I like the internal water filter, the auto on and off features, as well as the different cup sizes. The most disappointing thing about this Keurig is the display. The touch screen display does not work most of the time and its very frustrating. It's difficult to power on and off the unit as well as changing the cups sizes. Thank goodness I programmed the Keurig to power on and off at a certain time. But if you want coffee outside of those programmed times, its frustrating to power the unit on or off. If there is a fix, please let me know.
review_title: I wished it worked all the time.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Love
review_text: I originally bought the K55, but I wasn't that happy with the quality of it. To me it just seemed very cheaply made, considering I was replacing the original model, what everyone is saying in the reviews is true. I guess it would have been fine, but I'm so happy I spent a little extra money to get this one....I absolutely love it, we shall see how long it holds up ;)
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Patricia Williams
review_text: Got this large volume Keurig for our group meetings. Works great. Fast. I bring a couple jugs of water from the grocery store and we  serve a ton of people. Works flawlessly. I bring an extention cord as we serve coffee and snacks from a table and not a kitchen counter. Group loves opportunity to choose their own beverage. Really added to our classes and lectures. Keeps people hanging around for social time.
review_title: Large size great for clubs and large social gatherings.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: tbelle
review_text: We must have gotten a total lemon and it appears that we are now out of our return window. It's just over 2 months old and already not working. Just a blank screen appears after we brew a cup. We have to unplug and lose any saved timers/clock every day. I'm super frustrated. My last Keurig lasted for 3 years. For something this expensive the return window should not expire in 30 days.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Larissa Fujimoto
review_text: I love this product. Before I divulge the glories of this machine, I would like to say that I was vehemently against Keurig machines. I am a grind and brew, French pressing, Chemex pour over, kind of girl.  The idea of using stale flavored coffee that's been sitting on a shelf for a month makes me want to take a cheese grater to the face. With that being said, I am now a Keurig convert.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Dee Dee
review_text: This was wonderful for the first few cups of coffee and cocoa but now is leaks.  After it brews and tells you the cup is ready, it constantly drips.  I have to put a cup under it to collect the drips.  Seems like that shouldn't be happening, I think my 8 ounce cup is short and then drips and drips.  Disappointed
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Geek On A Beemer
review_text: Works as expected, which is great.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Laura P.
review_text: This is a lot of money to pay for a coffee pot that you have to put your cup in the microwave to get it hot enough to be good.
review_title: ... the microwave to get it hot enough to be good.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Bookworm777
review_text: The one we bought from Costco stopped working after 4 years, and it is no longer made. This one was purchased as a replacement. Works well. Love the features. Wish it were quieter, but it s a coffee machine, so who really cares? Not those who grew up with regular coffee pots! Not a sound I can t stand. And being in The Seattle area means I gotta have that cup of joe in the am! Love the  Strong  setting. And user preference settings. Don t use them, but I still like that it s there.
review_title: Not as quiet, but great features.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Kassye
review_text: Absolutely love this item. We use it multiple times a day. It can program for the carafe. We have to refill the water every other day or so. We set the temperature on the second hottest and it's perfect for slow sipping. Settings from 4oz to 14 oz, plus carafe 3-4 cups or 4-5 cups. This box also came with two filter refills and the filter piece, as well as the needle maintenance item, a value of $20 or so. We got this during Black Friday and spent less on the Keuring, carafe, and reusable filter (including water filter and needle maintenance piece) than I would have buying this anywhere else. Not to mention the fact that in-store models don't have the water filter included.
review_title: Best deal of all Keurigs - Better value than in-stores
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Vickie Harvey
review_text: At first I had a lot of problems with it spitting grounds out into my cup of coffee. Called the Keurig company and found out that the k-cups that I was using had been flown during shipping and due to the pressure they were puffed up a little. Which is almost all of them.  What I had to do was after putting the k-cup in and closing the lid I open it and close it a second time and no more problems.  I love this coffee machine!
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I am surprised, after many years, that Keurig couldn't get some of these things right.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: LeighbothePianoMan
review_text: Happy!  After our old K55 brewer burnt beyond repair when set it on the stove while the refrigerator had to be moved, and didn't know the stove knob was on.  While we liked the features, especially the larger water reservoir, we were very hesitant due to all the comments about not accepting the original K-Cups that were not from Keurig, especially because we had a harge inventory of our favorite coffee, so were hesitant to pull the trigger on this one.  But after much time deliberation, and reading several web postings on workarounds (aka hacks) for using the original K-cups; I figured I'd take the time and energy to make and use one of the proven solutions until we got through our coffee inventory.  We made coffee that way for almost a week, until one day I forgot and put an original non-Keurig K-cup in the brewer - and it WORKED!  My wife made another cup the same way and VOILA!  So either Keurig modified the machine after too many complaints or we just simply got lucky - but the machine is working with each and every brand and type of K-cup we use.  Love the ability to make larger cups, and the extended time between refilling the water reservoir - plus the openable lid of the reservoir makes it easier to refill using a small water jug than having to take the reservoir on and put it back on full.  And of course, this is a much more attractive brewer than the old one; so very happy with our purchase.
review_title: Surprise: works great with ALL K-Cups!
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Ron
review_text: While we had to send one back for a bad display the second one arrived and has been working well for over a month so hopefully it was an anomaly. Build quality on this is plasticy as there really isn't any metal on it at all. The important part is it makes great coffee. Dark Magic and San Fransisco Fog Chaser are two favorites.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Not what I expected. Wish I would have kept the original Keurig. Cheaper quality ( more plastic) Longer brew time and expected it to make hotter coffee. Very disappointed.
review_title: Buyers regret should have kept original.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: S Libby
review_text: This is the third Keurig I purchased. I thought this newer model would last longer. I'm beginning to think the Keurig brand just isn't good. It has already started acting up. The screen goes blank so you can't brew your coffee. I am going to call customer service and see if they can help.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Robert Worsham
review_text: I had the simple Keurig and really enjoyed its performance. But this one blows the original one out of the water with a timer so the water is heated when I get up and the large tank is well worth the investment.  The price was outstanding beating a competitor near the mall by $40.00.  It also allows you to select strong coffee or standard coffee.  A great upgrade making my mornings much better.
review_title: I had the simple Keurig and really enjoyed its performance
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jack
review_text: This is my Second K475, both with the same problems,  every 3-4 cycles the brew cycle is interrupted and coffee grounds are all in my coffee.  I use the Green Mountain Breakfast Blend K-cup only.  I called Keurig and they said there was a problem with this model,  Returning to my old way of making coffee.  I had a Keurig for 4 years before this one and wore it out, but the new ones are nothing but trouble for me lately,  hope others are having success.  I give up.,...........fast forward to today,  OK  I didn't give up so much, My wife called Keurig, and they sent a replacement,  2nd cup of coffee,  same problem, called them back, they sent a replacement but in a different color.  they said to through the other one away,  5 cup of coffee, same problem,  called them back,  and on, and on, and on.  Sometimes after doing a maintenance cycle then clearing with just hot water cycle we would get a couple more good brews before it happed again.  Called Keurig,  they walked us through the cleaning cycles, by this time we have mastered, and set the 6 replacement.  It failed once in 12 cups so far. so were hopeful,  I was hoping for something to change each replacement,  but unless the "software" is the problem, nothing hardware wise has been altered.  I have wasted boxes of Kcups by now.  But there customer service with us has been outstanding, very willing to help and replace, and always seam genuinely surprised were having trouble.  I'm looking forward to the next generation, as I can't find "Old" versions at a reasonable price.
review_title: This is my Second K475, both with the same ...
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Carlos
review_text: This is my very first coffee maker and I'm happy with it. It of course isn't solely used for coffee in my house. It will be used for the first obvious, coffee, of course hot cocoa, tea, and making my life easier when I feel like having cup noodles. Is this thing a complete necessity? No, but it does make certain things easier while saving time. So hey, I'm glad I have this Keurig now. It is built pretty well but not too overly complicated.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: girlygirl
review_text: I had been looking for a replacement Keurig for months n months. There are MANY on the market and it's difficult to know which model works best for each individual.  In Nov, I bought a K15, but when you've had a digital Keurig, that model didn't fit my lifestyle. I purchased the K475 and luv luv luv it!!  It's sturdy, quiet, and has different brewing options. I hope this one lasts for as many years as my previous.
review_title: There are MANY on the market and it's difficult to know which model works best for each individual
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Hello kitty pearland
review_text: LOUD. The pump sounds like a train coming down the tracks. This was to replace my platinum b70 brewer. I cant live with the sound it makes even though it's got a lot of great features. Returning to Amazon and bought the K55 and am much happier although I can't brew a carafe with it.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Bernie J. Lofaso
review_text: I was pretty happy with this machine at first. The large water tank, temperature control and different brew sizes were welcomed features over my previous Keurig machine. But this one broke after only three months of use. (One to two cups a day use.) I contacted Keurig, they shipped a replacement which arrived quickly and seems to work properly. I'm supposed to return the k-cup holder from the old machine to Keurig, but 1) the owner's manuals are no longer on the Keurig website since it is a discontinued machine, 2) After having obtained a manual from another website, the instructions on how to remove this holder don't seem to correspond to my machine. 3) I have pushed, pulled and prodded on this part and can't figure out how it comes out. <shrug>
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: HarleyBill
review_text: Have had this since April 18 and I am having to do maintenance on it everyday. It will not make a cup of coffee without getting the message Water under pressure. Lift the Lid ,remove pod, Close lid. Put in a pod , Still doesn't work. So I do needle maintenance. Lift lid, pump orange bulb five times. After doing this 5 or 6 times I'll get a cup of coffee. Two or three cups and it does it again.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: George
review_text: When this machine worked it was great, the issue is it the screen stopped working on two of these machines back to back. After searching online it seems this is a very common issue with these and there were even YouTube videos showing how to fix it, unfortunately, all of those videos are for a previous revision of the machine. Both of the machines I had were the newest revision that they updated it to correct the screen issue, but it seems the new revision is just as bad as the old one.
review_title: Great when it works, bad build quality
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Dorothy Browning
review_text: In spite of trying different K-cups and K-pods we have had difficulty getting it to brew without it stopping because of "water pressure" build up.  We followed the instructions for taking care of the problem but to no avail.  When we finally decided there was no way we were going to be able to find an answer, it was too late to return it.  So today we are going to WalMart to get a simpler machine.
review_title: In spite of trying different K-cups and K-pods we have ...
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Swanson0426
review_text: Oh this machine makes me so sad.  I did not realize how weak the coffee would be. It makes sense though because the grounds have very short time in contact with the water.  I don t understand how these machines are so popular.  I miss my Melita. If you like coffee, the convenience this offers truly is not worth it.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Gary
review_text: Received my Keurig well, however after a week's use the pixelated screen blurred. It continued to become worse with each use. At this point, there are grey and black streaks running and the brew selections are a guessing game. Very displeased and would not recommend.
review_title: It continued to become worse with each use
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: S. Davis
review_text: I like the temp adjustment, ability to tailor easily for Hot Choc or Tea vs Coffee, and to adjust the strength level of the coffee.  Biggest complaint is I get up early while my wife is still sleeping and the K475 is about twice as loud as the old 60 we had; very loud rhythmic knocking noise when it is brewing and it seems to take about 20 seconds longer end to end to brew a cup.
review_title: Nice features but a lot louder than previous Keurig
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Karen Griffin
review_text: We had a Keurig Single coffee make for probably over 10 years... the handle broke, my husband fixed it quite the handy man... the cost to buy a new handle was too high... but maybe we should have done that... the new make is updated quite a bit, larger than our other maker which was $200+ at the time of purchase... but we are happy with this one...
review_title: New Keurig but miss our old one..
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: dirtymofo
review_text: Our second Keurig, this one is for the office. Works as described.  Being able to set the color of the LCD screen is a nice touch. Only complaint and the reason I took away a star is that it is very finicky about the k cup pods. It decides that some are not made for the machine with a warning on the LCD screen and will not brew.  I can visually see a difference but somehow it does. Otherwise great machine. Been using for a month now and it brews several cups a day.
review_title: Being able to set the color of the LCD screen is a nice touch. Only complaint and the reason I took ...
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Michael Mawhorter
review_text: When the coffee maker works it is great but I have had nothing but trouble with getting error messages and the brew stopping in the middle with high pressure warnings.  I have called customer service twice and went though all the cleaning that they recommended and I still have to flush a cup of water between each brew and then it may give me a full cup.  The last time they said my water was too pure as we used water from our reverse osmosis system.  So now we are trying regular tap water but will probably have to descale more often.  They did send me some free k-cups for my trouble but still very frustrated.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Kathleen
review_text: Our other keurig gave out.  This is the new and improved version. Will use any k cup regardless if it is a keurig brand cup. Also makes 12 oz cups great for ice coffee.  Has different strengths for pots (not included).  Just use pot from last keurig.  Originally did not want to purchase.  My husband likes strong, I don't.  I also like to try different brands and types of coffee.  Makes good coffee one cup at a time.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Dewey Barnes
review_text: I waited a while to make sure this was going to turn out to be a great Keurig coffee machine, and so far I love it. My last Keurig was a cheaper version that still lasted a couple of years, so I'm looking forward to a few years with this one. It has good water capacity and makes great coffee.
review_title: Great upgrade to my last Keurig
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: jg
review_text: We sent this thing back almost immediately. Most cups of coffee had grounds spit throughout them and within a few days we were already having to  burp  this Keurig. Just got a K55 as a replacement and it won t stop saying Add Water even though the reservoir is completely full, so this one is going back too. Keurig has let their quality go way downhill.
review_title: Want some coffee with your grounds?
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: jowhit67
review_text: Got this about two months ago and love it!  Makes a perfect cup in less than a minute.  Easy to use, and lots of different settings you can adjust to your liking.  I also like the larger tank so it needs refilling less often.  My husband uses the carafe and it works well for him...medications that he takes makes him shake, so carrying a single cup from the cabinet to the table is difficult.  The carafe for this model works very well.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jim H.
review_text: Fantastic Coffee device! We love it and use it several times daily. I don't recommend a coffee addiction, but I do recommend this Keurig HIGHLY!
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Patricia
review_text: This is my second Keurig. I previously had the K70.  I do like the new Keurig K475, and would give it 5 stars except it is LOUD ...very LOUD when pumping water...at first I thought there was something wrong since my K70 was not loud but read a couple other reviews that theirs was loud.  I'm curious if others have found the it loud and if the loudness was annoying or is it just me because I am comparing it to the older classic Keurig.
review_title: Loud, but a great cup of coffee
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: This model I brought for work came with no instructions or maintenance information and it is asking us to clean the needle everyday. How does one do this and can we  do it well enough that we don't have to do it so often? My Keurig at home has only had to be cleaned about every 6 months and it is 4 years old and runs great. This new model is very frustrating.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: grandmax7
review_text: I bought this Keurig on November 6th.  It lasted about 4 weeks and then the screen went blank. Fortunately I bought a 3 yr appliance protection plan so they replaced it for free.  Just had to ship the old one back.  Now I have had it since middle of December and about 2 weeks ago the screen went blank on it.  To date I  cannot get anyone to respond to my requests about this.  Not sure why I bought the 3 yr protection when they won't do anything about it.  This is the 4 Keurig I have had in the last 4 years.  Definitely will NOT HAVE ANOTHER KEURIG.  They are a piece of junk as far as I am concerned..
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jon Vena
review_text: Six months in and the LED screen and hard water / deposit sensors are completely inoperable (and we use filtered water.) A complete 180 from our previous Keurig. This one is junk.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jami Rose
review_text: Works great..  but not so much with store brand pods.  An error screen shows up wanting you to open it up..  I read a lot of people threw it out because of this.. DONT!  Just open it and close it and it will work...  works great with name brand pods just not Kroger brand..  it still works just a lil more trouble.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: john bettano
review_text: Ok here we go. this product came in two days perfect. Nothing wrong with the packaging or the product. until we filled it with water and made some coffee and tea. the water that came out of the system tasted awful so we emptied the water holder washed it and did it again in fact we used up all 70oz and it still had that awful taste to the water. the wife called Keurig direct. Wow customer service was awesome. We explained how we just received it today. anyway they are sending us a new K75 system along with a box of coffee. we are not new to Keurig our old one is 5 years old we decided to upgrade to the K75. though the product was defective Keurig stood behind it and sent out a replacement that day.
review_title: this product came in two days perfect. Nothing wrong with the packaging or the product
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Shoreldy
review_text: I've had two other Keurig coffee machines. This one is my favorite by far.  Coffee is hot, I can adjust the strength and amount dispensed. Tastes awesome. Arrived super quickly.
review_title: This one is my favorite by far
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Captain Jim
review_text: Power cord is approximately 1 foot long....that is ridiculous. Also cup drip tray is loose and now way to attach it to coffee maker. It just sits there. I think there should be a simple snap on attachment for that. If you touch it, it moves. Other than that it seems to be a quality product. I will say that if I had know about those two issues I would not have purchased this coffee maker.
review_title: Power cord is approximately 1 foot long....
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Kevin Mckay
review_text: I have used a wide variety of Keurig models over the last few years and this has so far been one of the easiest to use overall.  Some models sound like they're on their last gasp (even when new) every time they brew a cup, but this one sounds steady and strong.  We have used it for everything hot water to a wide variety of K-Cups and (my fave) brewing loose yerba mate in the reusable filter cup.  No problems of any sort.  I like the ability to configure wake/sleep times, the capacity of the water reservoir , and the easy to use touch-pad interface.
review_title: Best of the Keurig models I've used to date
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Julie H.
review_text: Either my machine is faulty or the instructions are complete amiss. EXAMPLE: I can get to 14oz cup, but can't save it ... I can't turn it off without unplugging it ... I can't get to the settings without lowering the handle and then "Lift to begin" ... The clock doesn't retain it's time even AFTER saving at least 7 times.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Lauren Larson
review_text: Works very well and I'm happy with the coffee it brews.  I wish Keurig would figure out a better system for water storage, however.  The lid that covers the water reservoir is just stupidly designed and more for looks than anything else.  It's best to just take the whole thing off to fill it and it doesn't clip in or anything, it just sits there.  Outside of that complaint, it's a nice system and very convenient.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I don't know why it took me so long to order one of these.  I love it! I have always had to put my coffee in the microwave after making until I received this coffee maker.  Now its hot right in the cup, fresh and best of all its saving me money as I'm no longer wasting coffee everyday.  Coffee is to expensive to make a huge pot just for myself when one or two Kcups is enough for me.
review_title: Great buy, new model even better price!
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: P. Gonia
review_text: I don't like this as well as my old Keurig.  It is more difficult to extract the used k-cups. You have to wait after installing a new cup before you can press start. It makes funny noises.  It leaked all over once with flow coming from multiple directions not directly into the cup. The water container needs filling more often than the old. Let me know if you figure out how to properly use the karafe feature. I have not as yet.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Gavin Bitz
review_text: Pure pure junk. Had it for just over 2 months and the screen failed.  Can't read anything.  Can't program or set brew settings  you get what you get.  Stay away from this unit.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Darlene
review_text: This Keurig has been a big disappointment. Bought in April 2017.
review_title: Not what they used to be.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Phil H.
review_text: Works perfectly with non barcoded Kcups even when not marked as being 2.0 compatible.. waiting for so long to replace the old one with the new kcup scanner scare.. never fear buy this and be happy with all the new bells and whistles and your Wal-Mart kcups..
review_title: never fear buy this and be happy with all the new bells and whistles and your ...
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jonny Valtimore
review_text: For 3 months we loved this Keurig after having issues with other models in the past. Then out of nowhere the machine continuously pumps water when it's turned on, not stopping until it has exhausted the entire reservoir. We have only ever used distilled water and have cleaned and maintained this machine religiously. If you're going to go this route, be prepared for a machine that will need to be replaced, maybe very soon.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: derevert f
review_text: Unit is okay, surprised it doesn't come with a Carafe for the price, and purchased the "freedom" stickers to use generic kcups. I just feel that the price was not competitive but I needed it fast for Mother's Day....Target had the same unit, in Stock for $15 less plus would have gotten a $25 gift card to pay for the Carafe. Should have shopped around.
review_title: Unit is okay, surprised it doesn't come with a ...
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size
