review_text: I have been having issues with my K-350 brewer, with one particular brand of pods exploding, spewing grounds into my coffee. Keurig representative said we will give you the K-475 as a replacement. It was either that, or a different model which I felt was inferior with what I have now.
review_title: Louder than my K-350, but K-475 is a vast improvement!
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Sludge Guzzler
review_text: I've had this brewer for about a year and it has been fine up until the last month when the software started acting up.  Usually after you brew a cup the heater will kick in and preheat the next cup but for some reason the heater does not kick in even though the display shows it is "preheating."  You can hear it when it heats so when there is no noise and when the display shows it is preheating there is a problem.  It will sit there and tell you it's preheating for over an hour but like I said, it's not.  During that time it is unusable.  Unplug it from the wall, let it sit for 15 minutes then plug it back in and it works fine for a few cups.  Then the problem repeats.  It started acting weird after brewing a few cups but now it goes into this endless loop after every cup.  Also, after you plug it back in you have to re-do your clock settings.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Steven Schafersman
review_text: I purchased a Keurig 475 for the house and, from Amazon, a Keurig 55 for the office. Both of these are part of the brand new 2.0 generation. When I used them, I was surprised at how bad the coffee tasted no matter what brand I used. It was flat and tasteless. I had Keurig-brewed coffee before and it had been better, although certainly not as good as coffee made with a press or filter drip system. Also, the coffee was lukewarm a minute after brewing. I thought this was odd. Then last week I was visiting a building that had an old Keurig coffee brewer and I had brought my own K-cups knowing that the ones provided were not very good. The coffee brewed by that machine was both hotter and tasted better and I realized what the problem was: the new Keurigs don t heat the water at a high enough temperature to correctly brew coffee so its aromatic components are fully expressed. I searched the net using google about new Keurigs and brew temperature and got dozens of results that confirmed my conclusion.
review_title: I was surprised at how bad the coffee tasted no matter what brand I used
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: edb6
review_text: HORRIBLE! Do not buy the 2.0 Kuerigs! They are made to ONLY accept Kuerig brand cups and the machine even rejects those half of the time...increasing the cost of your cup of coffee and creating a mess for you to clean up, also! Got rid of that huge pain and replaced it (for 1/4th of the price) with an ICoffee, Davinci. The ICoffee Davinci actually make a better brew with it's spinning needle, can be purged of water within the machine for vacation time. Kuerig's main body cannot be purged of water, so it retains old, stale, icky water after non-use and serves it to you when you use it again!!!
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Titania
review_text: This machine was a gift. After trying it for a month I do not use it any longer. The water does not get hot enough to brew a tasty cup of coffee. You can use only expensive Keruig  K cups.which makes this machine undesirable. There is a cumbersome work-around to let it use other brands.  I don't want to bother doing that. The mechanism is hard to clean. You cannot empty the water reservoir when you intend to transport the machine or when  you will not be using it for a while. Think of all that stale water lying in there..If I should receive another one as a gift I will return it immediately.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Cheryl A. DeJulius
review_text: We purchased this coffee  maker when our last Keurig finally bit the dust . . .we generally have loved the Keurig systems and have had several over the years . . . this one however, has been pretty much a lemon from the word go . . .it is quite temperamental and finally after using it daily since purchasing in late July, 2017, it refuses to make coffee on New Years Day . . .we have gone through the regular list of jumping through hoops that is "normal" for all Keurigs . . .yes, the needle unit has been cleaned, yes the unit has been cleaned with vinegar water and yes, we have coaxed and pampered it and yes, we even tried calling Keurig as we have house guests and cannot serve coffee. . .its New Years Day and of course, they are closed!  For the very first time, I WOULD NOT recommend this particular unit!!  It is way too needy and finicky for us!!  We will get another Keurig but I would highly recommend leaving this one on the shelf . . .it is NOT deserving of a raving review!!
review_title: If you want a good coffee maker, DO NOT buy this one!  Keurig, YES, This Model NO~
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: K Finley
review_text: Do not buy this model. This is our second Keuring (after our first one gave us three good years of service but then stopped working). We bought this one and noticed immediately how many times it does not work. It often does not recognize the pod you put in - telling you "Oops" you put in the wrong thing...when you didn't. Then you have to play with it over and over again to get it to work. This is exactly what a consumer feels like doing early in the morning.
review_title: Doesn't work when all you want is a cup of coffee!
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: ndmertens
review_text: I absolutely loved my original Keurig brewer. Recently, the Keurig 1.0 in our office broke and, of course, Keurig replaced it with this model that only accepts proprietary cups. It is definitely a stylish look over the older brewers; however, this product only deserves one star until they fix their anti-consumer policies and allow owners to brew whatever coffee they want. Go with a third-party K-cup brewer or find a 1.0 model--they will last longer and accept all K-Cups.
review_title: I absolutely loved my original Keurig brewer
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Terry K
review_text: The original Kurig's cups will not work in the new Kurig 2 machines. Now thanks to Kurig you have to use their pods. Why the change... it's simple, they are greedy... period. The only real reason for the change is for Kurig to control the sale of the pods as the machine "scans" the pod and verifies if it's real or not. If not you are out of luck. Even though there are "hacks" out there to defeat the scan I will not buy a machine that controls how I use it. Hack or not... say NO to Kurig. Their sales have dropped as a result and they have dropped the price of the 400 and 500 series models to "encourage" buyers.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: JeHa
review_text: I received this Keurig 2.0 K475 as a gift in December 2017.  I had been refusing to get one, unless it had a reusable pod and carafe option.  The individual packaged pods seemed so wasteful and environmentally bad.  It worked well until the past few months when it would suddenly just top in the middle of a brew or not heat/dispense water at all.  I called customer "dis-"service and had a very disappointing experience with them, all the way up to a corporate office representative, Mark.
review_title: Product changes and poor customer services
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Gabriela Baez
review_text: Our Keurig was part of our wedding registry. We were so excited to upgrade from the one I got 4 yrs ago. Unfortunately, a month after I got to set it up, the screen would flake on us. At times, it would go white or have lines through it. I would need to unplug it and plug it back in, in order to start working again. Some times, i would need to unplug it and plug it back in more than a handful of times. It was becoming too much of inconvenience and requested a refund. Hopefully, we'll get one that is not defected the next time.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Flythisnotthat
review_text: I owned a Keurig Classic for about five years. Although it was noisy, it was ultra-reliable, and never once did it ever fail to make me a cup up coffee through five years of daily use. Well, eight months ago we received a K425 as a wedding gift, which is identical to the 475, but with different included accessories. I donated my old Classic to my local church. The K425 worked great for about four months, but then got its first of numerous "overpressure" malfunctions. After doing some internet research, I used the included needle flushing bulb as directed, and it started working again. These malfunctions became more frequent as time passed, and then one day early this month, the unit gave ne a notification that it was "time to descale!" I was about to make a cup and did not have white vinegar in the house at the time, so I selected "later" on the touchscreen. Well, the unit must have gotten mad at me for not descaling it right then, because after I made that one cup of coffee, the "overpressure" screen came back, and would NOT go away--even after unplugging the unit for several hours. I spent hours trying to fix the unit. I used the needle flushing tool more times than I could remember, I tried hollowing the needle out with a paper clip, and I even tried disassembling the unit and cleaning out the plastic tubes inside with a pipe cleaner. No joy with any of those fixes; the unit was frozen. My educated guess is that the shutdown was more likely a firmware failure than a mechanical problem, since it had just made a perfect cup of coffee literally seconds earlier. I ended up throwing the unit into the dumpster, since Keurig wanted me to pay for shipping to return the unit, and my eventual disassembly would have voided the warranty anyway.
review_title: 8 months ago: shiny new product, makes good coffee. Now: 13-lb. paperweight.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Sharon
review_text: I will never buy another keurig! I have had two. My first one lasted less than a year. I called Keurig and they did replace it. It has been about a year and the one they sent is doing the same thing. It won't brew complete cup of coffee or it wont shut off and it overflows. I have descaled it with the descaling product and cleaned all the different parts I can get to this includes the needles. When you think about how much the cost they should last quite a bit longer! My last coffee pot lasted 6 years and was still working when my husband decided he wanted a Keurig. I donated my old drip machine, so now I will have to replace it.
review_title: I will never buy another keurig! I have had ...
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Bill
review_text: I received a new Keurig K475 for Christmas to replace an older B70 unit that was starting to fail. Comparing the two, the K475 is louder and slightly slower than my older unit. The place to put the coffee pod is tucked way back in where in the B70, the pod holder moves forward when you lift the handle which was way easier. The unit indicates it's out of water when there is still 2 or 3 inches of water in the reservoir. The new machine doesn't allow full access to the different menu selections which means, for example, I can't request it to brew a 14 or 16 ounce cup of coffee unless I have a "mug" pod in there. And finally, the K475 just seems cheaply made.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: SupermanFan68
review_text: This machine is the word Keurig machine I have every seen and I have owned three. From day one, the screen display has been iffy at best. Now it has stopped recognizing presses/taps on the screen completely. After unplugging and let stand for two hours nothing changed when plugged back in. The machines without the touch screen were far more reliable. Plus this machine makes a horrible pumping sound - much worse than previous models. Skip this model - simply unreliable.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: As far as I can tell the machine works as advertised.  I purchased it thinking I would use the Keurig MY K-Cup reusable filters with my own Fair Trade organically grown coffee but the filters leave sediment in every cup of coffee even with coarsely ground coffee beans.  I spent 3 months allowance on the entire system, coffee maker, carafe, Keurig reusable filters, third party carafe filter and it was not worth my time or money.  I should have known this coffee maker would only work with the disposable coffee k-cups.  Bad choice on my part. What a waste of money!
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: John Demyan
review_text: I bought one of these from Sam's Club.  What a waste!  Keurig has rigged the machine to reject anyone else's pods.  Yes, It is possible to jiggle the handle or use extra pressure to hack , but why should a brand new unit need to be hacked?  Why should the consumer be given the "bait and switch" by Keurig.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: 2570TC
review_text: I'm so disappointed. Had an older Keurig and loved it. Gave it to our daughter and decided to replace it with a new one.  First bought a Keurig SELECT and it stopped working after one month.  It would not fill the coffee cup to the correct level. It would run for maybe 10 seconds and stop. Returned the coffee maker to the store where purchased.  Decided to up grade the next Keurig to a model 475.  We really liked the looks and features it offered. After the initial set up, we could not believe Keurig would make a coffee maker as loud as this one.  On top of the noise, the second cup of coffee was full of grounds.  Cleaned the coffee maker and tried another k-cup  (all K cups were Keurig brand) and this one worked fine. out of the next 5 cups of coffee made,  2 more had grounds in the coffee cup. I went on line to see if I was doing something wrong.  I soon realized that my complaints were shared by many others. In my opinion, Keurig has a design problem with there newer machines and haven't taken the time to fix it.  I should not have to clean the needle after two cups of coffee.  My old Keurig worked years with out having to clean the needle and never made the noise this new one does. I'm returning this Keurig and buying a different brand.  Keurig should not treat their customers this way. I hope if you buy a keurig your experience will be a good one and not like mine. I never bother to write product reviews but I think others need to know what they too may experience with a new Keurig coffee maker.
review_title: I'm so disappointed. Had an older Keurig and loved it
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jeeper98
review_text: My review is not verified because I bought it at target not amazon. But if you do get one of these I reccomend getting a warranty for sure, because after owning it for a year it s been doing funny stuff lately. Today, it only brewed half a cup of coffee while struggling to pump it. I ran hot water through it and it came out with brown water, so I don t know what s the problem but I m looking up ways to clean it and / or unclog it. Also, a few months ago it for some reason spit all the brewed coffee through the front  too fast , and dropped all over. Other then these problems it s been amazing and My family has used it about 2 times a day everyday. We really do like it.
review_title: because after owning it for a year it s been doing funny stuff lately
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: FREETHINKER1602
review_text: Maybe I'm simply too easily impressed. I have no complaints with the new keurig 2.0 system. I got it for my birthday in December. If you call Keurig and give them the number on the coffee machine they'll send you up to 5 replacement boxes of coffee from their store. I do like K-cups, but do not insist on using them. Honestly, K-cups are one of the worst things ever invented because of the environmental impact of the waste from the cups. I use one of the reusable filters and put my own coffee in. I have to have a cup of coffee every morning.  I had one of the first keurig machines 5 years ago. It was the little machine that could. It worked for all those years but started producing less and less coffee per cup even though I used the big cup setting. So the 2.0 was gifted to me and I'm quite pleased. I like all the specialty instant drink options. For example with the Tassimo-T coffee maker, if you want a cappucino you have to use 2 different pods. That's a lot of waste. So I like the premixed drinks offered for the keurig machine. I am a coffee snob. I have an espresso machine, a french press and a large brewer. Keurig 2.0 is a good quick fix for my coffee habit cravings. It's simple, fill the little cup with coffee, put it in the machine, push a button. I feel like the other coffee making things I have require more effort and seem ritualistic. Nowadays, I don't run into the problem of incompatible K-cups because the Keurig 2.0 has been around for a while now. Many retailers will not have the defunct cups.
review_title: It's easy and helps me get my coffee fix
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Chris Toomey
review_text: Expensive and not eco-friendly.  Each single pod averages $2.  The first cup is too strong, the 2nd about right and the 3rd colored water.  If I have to add water to dilute, instant coffee to taste with every cup I make just to get a drinkable cup forget it!  Same with refillable pod.  The pods are plastic and cannot be composted.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Leland Smyth
review_text: Don't waste your money.  Foe near the same price get the ninja coffee bar!  After having the keurig foe some time the coffee comingbout was mediocre and the pods are ridiculously expensive!  The ninja you can bre single cups or wjols pots at different strengths and is soooooo much better than the keurig!  Plus less wateful as you can't recycle the pods.  Seriously if your  true coffee whore like me....ninja is the way to go.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: vt
review_text: After many years, my B60 died on Monday morning. If the sellers weren t gouging people on the few that are left, I would have bought another B60. This unit has a lot of features I will never use but what I have used, worked fine. It is slower and much louder than the B60. It makes noise through the entire brew process vs. just hearing the dripping and then the louder end of the brew. A good feature is being able to adjust the temp.One complaint I have, that is only cosmetic, is the entire top is shiny black, instead of matt black like the B60 so be prepared to dust the top constantly as it shows every speck of dust and prints if you happen to touch it.
review_title: worked fine. It is slower and much louder than the ...
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: fmj
review_text: I will make it clear I did not buy this Keurig off of Amazon, but I absolutely hate it!  This is my 3rd Keurig and I'm very disappointed:
review_title: but I absolutely hate it! This is my 3rd Keurig and I'm ...
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: This has to be the worse single serve coffee pot out there!  I have this one shown.  I have the temp on the highest selection and it s tepid, not hot!  If there is any air whatsoever in the Kcup, it explodes in the coffee maker!  The grinds come out the top and go everywhere!  Imagine waking up to that!  Besides those K cups are expensive!!  If you have had this 1 day over a year, Keurig won t even talk to you!  They refer you to You Tube videos!  So now you are out the $130-160 for the pot plus whatever you have spent on k-cups!  It s ridiculous!  I m going back to plain old drip coffee maker!  Don t waste your money!
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Casey Martinson
review_text: Screen quality started to deteriorate and then went completely blank. I'm now going to throw this thing into the garbage and get a different one. This was 200+ at the time and I don't know why it wouldn't still be going strong if they didn't cheap out on the small screen because otherwise it works. Poor decision, Keurig. Fire whoever made that bonehead engineering decision.
review_title: Was okay for year and a half, then screen crapped out
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Mark Pavlic
review_text: This does everything you'd expect from a Keurig and more. It makes a solid cup of coffee relatively quick with simple cleanup while giving you the option to change from numerous different sizes and brew strengths, something that my home Keurig didn't have. The touch screen is great, the interface is easy to use, and all of the options of setting brew timers among other things are everything what some tired drub in the office would love to have on their coffeemaker when they drag themselves in in the morning.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: P. M.
review_text: This is the first negative review I have written about anything anywhere ever.  I had an issue with the needle on my machine today.  There was a number on the screen to call for support so I called the number.  During a few unhelpful moments with the support person she requested my email and name which I gave her.  Now, a few hours later, still with a non-functioning machine I received an email from Keurig that I've been registered on their site and opted in for more promotional email....which I in no way wanted or consented to in the call.  Now trying to log in so I can opt out, I'm sent through an endless loop of register, change password, log in, the site doesn't load, and have to go back to the log in page.... and I can't find a way to opt out.  I liked the machine before today...after today I'd rather chew burnt coffee beans that use another Keurig.  Opting me in for spam without my consent felt like an unnecessary insult.  On the upside, I'm looking forward to my "Office Space" style rendezvous with my non-functioning Keurig in a field somewhere.
review_title: Needle Issue - Frustrating Experience with Support
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: plknj
review_text: Love Keurig but did not like this machine, gave it away and purchased another model.  We never had a problem with our first Keurig until it quit, this one has been nothing but a problem having to take it apart and clean the inside every few cups.  Went with the K55 which stands more upright.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Debbie
review_text: Love my keurig, and the customer service is spot on. This machine does it all, make a pot,cup or mug. Takes all the sizes of the cups. I love the size of the water resevoir. I rarely brew a carafe or mug.......if I ever have to replace I will get the kcup brewer only because that s really all I brew.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: ERIC PETERSEN
review_text: This is the worst Keurig I have ever had. I exchanged the first one because I thought it was a defect, but with the replacement we have continued to have the same issues. It continuously bust the K-cup and you get a lot of coffee grounds in your cup of coffee. I have used ONLY Keurig cups since this machine also limits you to those only, but the problem still exist. I have to put the K Cup in really gentle and slow to make sure the needle barely punctures the K Cup, but that only works 50% of the time. If you are a person that jumps up and is a hurry to get to work or kids to school this is NOT the machine for you!
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Lindsey & Adam
review_text: We had problems from day one with this. Very disappointing compared to one we had before lasted well over 5 years without a single issue.  Nothing we did fixed it. Received error messages, thing would keep pouring after saying it was done, constantly needing cleaned.
review_title: Keurigs are good, just not this model.

I just spent over an hour on tech support -they graciously offered to send me a single use reusable pod - but they do not have a carafe size reusable.  If you just want to pay extra to have their branded pods this might be for you - if you want to brew whatever you want stay far away from this junk.
review_title: Bad Company - Draconian K-Cup policy on this unit.

I run the needle cleaning at least 5-times a day, and it does nothing except waste my pods. Don't waste your money. Mine is junk.

Error messages.....ok...not using our old cups.....use maintenance device....never had to on our prior machines.  We have a Keurig for a quick,easy coffee option.  Too many features have rendered this a machine that requires too much fuss to suit that purpose.

Tried a recommendation of using vinegar, but did not help at all to get rid of the taste. Basically un-usable. Waste of money. Can't believe Keurig can get away with selling these things.

review_text: Bought this at another big box store four months ago and never really cared for it. It constantly clogged after just a few pots and had to go through the unclogging procedure. I used several different kinds of pods including theirs but never got it to work. The hot water was very frustrating. I had to put in a blank pod to get a full cup.  I gave it away to my neighbor
review_title: Bought this at another big box store four months ago ...

name: PT H.
review_text: I bought the Keurig K475 based, in part, on the positive reviews as well as the fact that it could brew coffee in a carafe.  After a month's use, I returned it because:  1) the LCD screen consistently did not work properly; 2) despite having various temperature settings, it didn't brew coffee hot enough; 3) the coffee tasted weak; 4) there was no strong setting for brewing coffee for the carafe; 5) it took long to preheat and brew coffee; and 6) it had a large footprint and looked "massive".  The first four reasons were deal breakers.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

review_title: Definitely  Not  up to the Keurig standards.

name: Milly
review_text: I got this as a gift for my grandma and she couldn't be happier. She has invited everyone she knows in for a cup of their favorite drinks. Technology can be a bit tricky for her but this is incredibly easy for her to use. She was very nervous at first cause of all the options but it has turned out to be very simple to use. Everyone who has stopped in for a cup is in love.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Steve Long
review_text: I started to give 1 star and maybe should have. I will say it makes a good cup of coffee. Problems, I hate the digital set up to turn the pot on and off. I want a cup in the morning, then turn the maker off. Oh it is on a timer, can't.  Has about 1/4-1/3 water left,hit start for a 12 ounce cup , don't hear the NOISE, VERY noisy pump, so look,  must add water, not out  but must add water so coffee maker will work;  pain when getting ready.  What happened to turn on, preheat water, add k pac, hit start-no noise and coffee in a minute. Keurig almost seems to be driving customers away. If this one lasts as long as my old one (doubt it, too high tech), before I buy another one, I will use it and see what "improvements" they have made. Any more improvements like this and they will be out of business.  Maybe they are trying to appeal to the silicon valley geeks that like bright shiny things with touch screens ( screen is easy to use, to make coffee, select cup size, hit strong and press start, unless it isn't half full of water, then must add water.)  On a side note, the red ( my color choice) looks good.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Paul Cash
review_text: Let me say that I have owned two Keurig coffee makers and I love the ease and ability to customize both the taste and size of my drink. Prices for K-Cups  and the coffee maker may be a bit high but are generally acceptable. My rating is a result the durability of the coffee makers. I had an electrical problem with my Keurig and now the display has disappeared from my 2.0 K475. I contacted the company and the only solution they offer is a discounted new purchase. While the price is discounted it is no less that a sale price elsewhere.
review_title: Does not appear to hold up under what I would call medium level use.
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Yingzi Xin
review_text: It worked fine for a couple of months.  In fact, it made a great cup of joe.  Then I started having the blank-screen issue...first just once or twice a week, then almost daily.  I checked the FAQ and some other online sources, and the initial fix was to simply unplug, then replug the power cord.  And this worked initially.  But soon unplugging the machine stopped working all together.  By this point, the limited warranty had I expired.  So a $150 coffee maker lasted me only two or three months, then worked only a fraction of the time, then not at all.  I have noticed that the newer models don't have screens, and the K 1.0 models don't have screens, and they seem to work fine.  Buy at your own risk!
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Sean Foley
review_text: My wife bought this and every cup of coffee she makes tastes like plastic. She has washed and scrubbed and rinsed and 50/50 water/vinegar'd the thing eight ways from Tuesday but everything that comes out of it tastes like plastic. I read an article online that said the manufacturer made the water filter out of a material that couldn't handle the high temperatures and would leak chemicals into the water. For $100+, I expect more from a device than this. Seems almost criminal.
review_title: ... this and every cup of coffee she makes tastes like plastic. She has washed and scrubbed and rinsed ...

This WON'T USE 3RD PARTY OLDER STYLE K-CUPS! WON'T USE THE REUSABLE ECKO STEEL K-CUPS. AVOID THIS MACHINE. IT'S KEURIG'S WAY TO SCREW YOU INTO BUYING ONLY THEIR K-CUPS.

I am still not satisfied that it just dribbles out and I have to wait 4  minutes to get a 8 ounce cup of coffee.  It's only a matter of days to where it stopped working completely.I have to say Keurig products are crap now  and I can tell by the reviews here at 18 percent  of the people who purchase this machine  set only giving this one just one star. This just verifies my opinion.  Why care today company make a quality product anymore .  Because they put a life on it so that when it feels to get you to buy another one.

review_text: Our family got this Christmas. We also got an assorted box of coffee, hot chocolate, and a box of Earl Grey tea ( I drink tea and not coffee). We also have six refillable cups as well. I have not used the refill for tea yet (I have some loose leaf tea that I may try later) but we do have it coffee and it works well. I have tried the Earl Grey tea and the Swiss miss hot chocolate. They are both very good and the hot chocolate doesn't leave a lot of thick sludge at bottom like old packets of hot chocolate would.
review_title: Great machine for quick coffee or tea
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Boo Zack
review_text: Keurig makes these machines knowing that they have defective touchscreen monitors. Without the touchscreen working, this machine is completely useless. Both the model I bought and my brother bought had the exact same problem, yet we were able to get no help from Keurig regarding their defective products.
review_title: this machine is completely useless. Both the model I bought and my brother ...
product_name: Keurig K475 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jason
review_text: I am coming from a virtuoline nespresso machine which I now appreciate with all of my coffee loving heart. The taste in coffee is night and day the coffee the keurig produces at its best is not even as good as Nespresso's worst coffee. Though keurig has so much more variety in terms of flavors and blends as well as temperature control and cup sizes (in ounces) it is still no match for the coffee the nespresso vertuoline produces. If you are ok the fence about this one and nespresso go for the nespresso machine it is more expensive to own but well worth the price.

I called Keurig customer service yesterday and I will be receiving a free replacement within 3-7 business days.  Call them first before purchasing a new one if you have the same issue.  I totally wasn't expecting a free replacement after some of the reviews I read.  I gave them the S/N on the side of the unit for them to verify the model, etc, and I'll have to return the black pod holder when I receive the new Keurig.  We'll see how long the next one lasts...

review_text: I have never, ever written an Amazon review in the 14 or so years I have used the site. But I absolutely HAD to take the time to caution users NOT to buy this coffee maker. On my first machine, I had to do this only every few weeks, but within three months, it was almost every use. Then, one day, the problem would no longer resolve/the error message disappear. I received a replacement and was thankful to at least not be out the money spent on the original one. I took the replacement out of the box, fired it up - and received the same error message. Someone who works at a retail store said that this is the most returned item they have in the store. Horribly, horribly flawed machine.
